Luckily, you're eligible for a $300 credit when creating your first GCP project# Google Gloud Platform pretrained ML services Notebook series

Welcome to this introduction level series about how to use Google Cloud pretrained ML services Python clients from Kaggle notebooks, without raw HTTP API calls. Four notebooks are prepared as reference guides:

* [Cloud Translation quick start notebook](https://www.kaggle.com/kornelregius/google-cloud-translation-tutorial)
* [Cloud Natural Language quick start notebook](https://www.kaggle.com/kornelregius/google-cloud-natural-language-tutorial)
* [Cloud Video Intelligence quick start notebook](https://www.kaggle.com/kornelregius/google-cloud-video-intelligence-tutorial)
* [Cloud Vision quick start notebook](https://www.kaggle.com/kornelregius/google-cloud-vision-tutorial)


## Before start, please read these important notes

Firstly, please note that <mark>Cloud Translation is a paid service</mark> and requires a GCP project with billing enabled to use. Please refer to [pricing page](https://cloud.google.com/translate/pricing). Also keep in mind, Translation API apply a [quota limit](https://cloud.google.com/translate/quotas#request_quotas) for requests/minutes.
Luckily, you're eligible for a $300 credit when creating your first GCP project.

Before you can start using any of these services, you must have a Google Cloud project that has the service API enabled.

1. Select or create a GCP Project
2. Enable Billing. Remember to understand pricing prior to this step.
3. [Enable Cloud Translation API](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/library/translate.googleapis.com)

In order to use Google Cloud Services from Kagge notebooks, you need to attach your Google Cloud Platform account to this notebbok. Select 'Add-ons' menu above then 'Google Cloud Services'.
- If you have already attached Google Cloud account to your Kaggle account, please just attach it to this notebook as well.
- Otherwise, you need to attach your account to your Kaggle profile (and this notebook) by selecting 'Google Cloud AI Platform' integration and adding an authorized account.

*Unsuccefull attachment, will cause "Could not automatically determine credentials." error response when you want to instantiate a Python client.* 

## Google Cloud Platfrom [Cloud Translation](https://cloud.google.com/translate)

Currently, Kaggle and Google Cloud offers two major client versions to access Translation features:

* Basic API client, known as Translation v2, see [Official quick start guide for basic translation features](https://cloud.google.com/translate/docs/basic/quickstart)
* Advanced API client, known as Translation v3, see [Official quick start guide for more advanced translation features](https://cloud.google.com/translate/docs/advanced/quickstart)

Advanced API, has more features such as
* [Glossary](https://cloud.google.com/translate/docs/advanced/glossary)
* [Batch Translations](https://cloud.google.com/translate/docs/advanced/batch-translation)
* [Translate with Custom AutoML Models](https://cloud.google.com/translate/docs/advanced/batch-translation#batch-request-custom)

Check the [list of Basic and Advanced features side-by-side](https://cloud.google.com/translate#section-4).
